text:
"You've given me exactly what I needed to make a difificult decision."


Flag Officer, BUMED



WHY HEALTH ANALYSIS?

Your Needs

We start with your needs and collaborate with you throughout the project lifecycle to ensure we meet or exceed your expectations, and produce the highest quality service and deliverables.

Our Expertise

We add our unique expertise, using our agile analytics capabilities and access to a broad range of Military Health System data to develop valuable insights regarding specific populations, conditions, procedures, and facilities.

Proven Results

We produce credible, relevant results. Our products drive more effective health care standards and practices to improve clinical outcomes and reduce costs.

Key Capabilities:
- Process Improvement. We identify, analyze, and improve business processes. Our recommendations for the periodic health assessment process resulted in \$20M in annual savings.
- Care Management Tool Development. We create tools based on clinical practice guidelines and subject matter expertise that help you manage patients and their care. The Sleep Study Referral tool generated $\$ 4.8 \mathrm{M}$ annual cost savings and more selective consultations at a single facility.
- Geospatial Analysis. We map data to analyze complex problems. Our geospatial analysis identified the best potential areas for clinic relocations by showing the relationship between population distribution, drive times to clinics, and purchased care use.

Who We Are

We comprise a team of clinicians, epidemiologists, biostatisticians, clinic and project managers, and other health professionals with extensive experience in public health, data analytics, military medicine, and related disciplines.

Our skill sets include:
- Advanced Biostatistics
- Clinical Research Investigation
- Consultation Support
- Epidemiologic Methods
- Geographical Information Systems
- Metrics Development
- Predictive Analytics
- Research/Study Design
- SAS Programming
- Scientific Publications
- Strategic Communications

What We Do

We deliver clinical performance measurement, epidemiological study design, consultation and education, cancer surveillance, and health research. We also provide input to Navy policy, conduct lectures, draft and advise scientific articles, and review objectives for feasibility of implementation and evaluation.

Guiding Principles:
- Credibility
- Customer Engagement
- Professional
- Accountability and Follow
- Relevance

Through
- Readiness Impact
- Process
- Return on Improvement Investment
- Best Practices
- Collaboration

"I trust CAPT Rockswold's group to give me the right analysis."

BUMED Action Officer
